title: Irrigation Survey Data from Clemson University Extension, 1997-2000
text: cuscirrigationsurvey R package contains survey data compiled South Carolina County Extension Agents Clemson University annually 1997-2000. data published previously Irrigation Journal (2001), cuscirrigationsurvey likely thorough compilation work available today. package author received data W. Bryan Smith, Area Extension Agent director irrigation survey efforts 1998-2000. survey conducted prior 1997, however data found made available package author. data gathered year county agents county, either sat growers knew irrigated acreage dealing . dataset provides unique perspective irrigation South Carolina, still relevant today. survey effort comprehensive ever conducted, comparable data collection efforts years afterwards. Lacking comprehensive data, later reports regarding irrigation SC estimated general declines 2000 2010. recently (~2015 - ~2020), reported irrigation South Carolina increased substantially. Hypothetically, recent increase can attributed -estimated values year 2000. ’s broader context, let’s see can learn dataset specifically. acccess dataset, can install package using R: , just scroll copy data tables .

title: Irrigation Survey Data from Clemson University Extension, 1997-2000
text: 44 different crops included dataset. plot top 10 irrigated crops (acreage).  Corn cotton two major irrigated crops, many minor irrigated crops. isn’t easy see plot, third ranking irrigated crop “Tree Fruits,” really means peaches mostly.

title: Irrigation Survey Data from Clemson University Extension, 1997-2000
text: still information survey, ’ve put separate table. includes information regarding irrigation power sources, wells, pumps.
code: ## This information is tabulated as the percentages in each county.  ## To estimate state-wide percentages, I'll weight the county percentages  ## by the irrigated area in each county.  total_acreage <- categories |>   dplyr::filter(is.na(Subcategory)) |>   dplyr::select(County, Year, Acres)  irr_attributes_statewide <- irr_attributes |>   dplyr::filter(!(Subcategory %in% c('Ave Water Depth', 'Ave. Depth', 'Number'))) |>   dplyr::left_join(total_acreage, by=c("County", "Year")) |>   dplyr::mutate(Value = Value*Acres) |>   dplyr::select(County, Category, Subcategory, Year, Value) |>   dplyr::group_by(Category, Subcategory, Year) |>   dplyr::summarise(Value=sum(Value, na.rm=T), .groups='drop')  irr_attributes |>   dplyr::select(Category, Subcategory) |>   unique()
